segments.text: Grandpa , this seat is for you , for you are the eldest person here and also it's your birthday today .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , you are such a good child today . Come here . Sit next to me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm afraid I can't do that . It's Dad's seat , according to the book about table manners .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , you read ? Very good . Then , I think we should do something different today . I'll give you some privilege .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Great . That's my favorite seat which will be the nearest to the birthday cake .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Now I see what you read the book for . But it's fine . I'll give you the lion's share .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why do they serve up the noodles first ? I don't like it . Where is the cake ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This is not common noodles . They're “ long-lived ” noodles.it ' s an old Chinese tradition to eat.long - lived noodle on birthday .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Then I'll try it .
segments.speaker: S1
